title: Functions for correlation analysis
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(ryx) ## basic example code library(MASS) object <- ryx(Boston, y = "medv") summary(object) print(object) plot(object)

what: Plotting Correlations between selected variable and other variables in selected dataset — plot.ryx

text: Creates visualizations correlations variables function works objects created using ryx function.

title: Plotting Correlations between selected variable and other variables in selected dataset — plot.ryx
Plotting Correlations between selected variable and other variables in selected dataset — plot.ryx
text: x object class ryx, generated ryx function. contains correlation, p-values, level significance selected variable variables selected dataset.

title: Plotting Correlations between selected variable and other variables in selected dataset — plot.ryx
text: plot object specific method. function returns visualization correlations selected variable variables selected dataset.

title: Plotting Correlations between selected variable and other variables in selected dataset — plot.ryx
code: # Example usage: library(MASS) object <- ryx(Boston, y="medv") plot(object)  data(mtcars) object2 <- ryx(mtcars, y="mpg") plot(object2)

title: Printing correlations between selected variable and other variables in selected dataset — print.ryx
Printing correlations between selected variable and other variables in selected dataset — print.ryx
text: x object class ryx, generated ryx function. contains correlation, p-values, level significance selected variable variables selected dataset.

title: Printing correlations between selected variable and other variables in selected dataset — print.ryx
text: function returns formatted print correlations selected variable variables selected dataset.

title: Printing correlations between selected variable and other variables in selected dataset — print.ryx
code: # Example usage: library(MASS) object <- ryx(Boston, y="medv") print(object) #> Correlations of medv with variables: crim, zn, indus, nox, rm, age, dis, tax, ptratio, black, lstat  #>       variable          r            p sigif #> cor10    lstat -0.7376627 5.081103e-88   *** #> cor4        rm  0.6953599 2.487229e-74   *** #> cor8   ptratio -0.5077867 1.609509e-34   *** #> cor2     indus -0.4837252 4.900260e-31   *** #> cor7       tax -0.4685359 5.637734e-29   *** #> cor3       nox -0.4273208 7.065042e-24   *** #> cor       crim -0.3883046 1.173987e-19   *** #> cor5       age -0.3769546 1.569982e-18   *** #> cor1        zn  0.3604453 5.713584e-17   *** #> cor9     black  0.3334608 1.318113e-14   *** #> cor6       dis  0.2499287 1.206612e-08   *** data(mtcars) object2 <- ryx(mtcars, y="mpg") print(object2) #> Correlations of mpg with variables: cyl, disp, hp, drat, wt, qsec, vs, am, gear, carb  #>      variable          r            p sigif #> cor4       wt -0.8676594 1.293959e-10   *** #> cor       cyl -0.8521620 6.112687e-10   *** #> cor1     disp -0.8475514 9.380327e-10   *** #> cor2       hp -0.7761684 1.787835e-07   *** #> cor3     drat  0.6811719 1.776240e-05   *** #> cor6       vs  0.6640389 3.415937e-05   *** #> cor7       am  0.5998324 2.850207e-04   *** #> cor9     carb -0.5509251 1.084446e-03    ** #> cor8     gear  0.4802848 5.400948e-03    ** #> cor5     qsec  0.4186840 1.708199e-02     *

what: Calculate Correlations Between Selected Variable and Other Variables — ryx
title: Calculate Correlations Between Selected Variable and Other Variables — ryx
text: Calculates correlations selected numeric variable numeric variables dataset. Users can specify numeric variables include comparison. numeric variable specified function compare selected variable variables data set. function also evaluates statistical significance correlation.

title: Calculate Correlations Between Selected Variable and Other Variables — ryx
Calculate Correlations Between Selected Variable and Other Variables — ryx
text: data data frame containing dataset analyzed. y character string specifying variable (must numeric) correlation analysis. x optional character string specifying variable user wants compare variable y . provided, numeric variables dataset except y used.

title: Calculate Correlations Between Selected Variable and Other Variables — ryx
text: object class ryx, includes y,x , df data frame variables interest, variable column name variable, r correlation coefficient, p p-value correlation test sigif significance level indicators.

title: Calculate Correlations Between Selected Variable and Other Variables — ryx
code: # Example usage with the MASS package library(MASS) object <- ryx(Boston, y = "medv")  # Example usage with the mtcars dataset library(datasets) object2 <- ryx(mtcars, y = "mpg")

what: Prints a summary of the correlations between the selected variable and other variables in the dataset — summary.ryx
title: Prints a summary of the correlations between the selected variable and other variables in the dataset — summary.ryx
text: Prints summary correlations selected variable variables dataset

title: Prints a summary of the correlations between the selected variable and other variables in the dataset — summary.ryx
Prints a summary of the correlations between the selected variable and other variables in the dataset — summary.ryx
text: x object class ryx, generated ryx function. contains correlation, p-values, significance levels selected variable variables selected dataset.

title: Prints a summary of the correlations between the selected variable and other variables in the dataset — summary.ryx
text: printed summary including: variables compared, median absolute correlation selected variable variables, range correlations, number variables significant p < 0.05 level.

title: Prints a summary of the correlations between the selected variable and other variables in the dataset — summary.ryx
code: # Example usage: library(MASS) object <- ryx(Boston, y="medv") summary(object) #> Correlating medv with crim zn indus nox rm age dis tax ptratio black lstat  #> The median absolute correlation was 0.427 with a range from 0.25 to 0.738  #> 11 out of 11 variables were significant at the p < 0.05 level. data(mtcars) object2 <- ryx(mtcars, y="mpg") summary(object2) #> Correlating mpg with cyl disp hp drat wt qsec vs am gear carb  #> The median absolute correlation was 0.673 with a range from 0.419 to 0.868  #> 10 out of 10 variables were significant at the p < 0.05 level.
